items.content:
Senior Accountant at Preemptive Love Coalition

Remote

Preemptive Love exists to end war – by using online tools for offline action to build the most diverse community of peacemakers on the planet. We are a global peacemaking movement working to heal all that’s tearing us apart. We do this primarily by working in polarizing conflict-zones. In Iraq and Syria, our portfolio of services include emergency aid and relief to families persecuted by terrorism and violence, and micro-economic development programs that empower women and men to provide for their own families.

Job Duties:

Support the finance and administrative operations of Preemptive Love Coalition, including:

  • Accounts payable
  • Reconcile cash receipts to transaction processing platforms (PayPal, Stripe) and the CRM system
  • Record transactions in accounting system
  • Standard costing, inventory, and product sales records
  • Iraq cash reconciliation
  • Bank reconciliation
  • Month-end close
  • Other tasks as needed

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 2-5 years accounting experience
  • Non-profit experience preferred
  • Experience with Intacct accounting software strongly preferred
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills
  • Ability to work remotely with minimal direct oversight
  • Must be able to maintain confidentiality
Apply for job

items.content:
Bookkeeper-Payroll Administrator at WhatConverts

Remote | Part-time
  • Charlotte, NC – Remote OK
  • Part-Time

We are looking to hire an experienced bookkeeper and payroll specialist using Quickbooks Online. This is a part-time role that requires approximately 10 hours a week with the time requirements heavier at the beginning of the month. This job will require some flexibility in which days are worked each week to coordinate with invoicing and payroll. You’ll be replacing our previous bookkeeper, who worked with us for 8 years.

About You:

  • At least 2 years of bookkeeping experience including payroll.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Experience with Quickbooks invoicing and payroll.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Experience with multiple state payroll withholding tax filing preferred.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Invoicing
  • Accounts Receivable and Payable
  • Payroll/Taxes to Federal and Multiple States
  • Bank and Credit Card Reconciliations
  • Financial Reports

About WhatConverts

For the past four years, WhatConverts has been helping people across the world track “What Marketing Converts to Leads”. A lead can be a phone call, web form submission, web chat or e-commerce transaction. Our software helps our customers track their marketing efforts to ensure it is giving them the best ROI.

We want to give advertisers and agencies the complete marketing picture by easily tracking their marketing dollars to actual leads, so they can best spend their budget.

We believe in small teams making a big impact. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management, and more getting the important things done.

The Package:

  • Location – Anywhere you want. If you want to work remotely or near others that’s fine by us. The current team is based in Charlotte, NC and Birmingham, AL.
  • Position – Part-time position.
  • Compensation – Based on experience.
Apply for job

tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 2W hour
items.content:
We are a fast-growing cloud accounting practice looking for an approachable and forward-thinking Remote Cloud Accounting Manager with recent public accounting experience.
This is remote position open to people living in Canada only.
About Star Company
Star Company is all about creating an awesome client experience! The key function of this role is ensuring our clients and getting useful, accurate financial information about their organization. You will use your extensive accounting knowledge, experience in cloud accounting, and killer client service skills to develop strong relationships with clients, create effective and efficient workflows, and ensure our team delivers high-quality work.

This a virtual position, however, you are still part of a very team-oriented office! The Star Company work schedule is flexible, but customer service is our priority. Team meetings and client communication structure our work, which is generally completed during standard EST business hours.
Specific tasks will be determined on an ongoing basis by client needs but will include the following:

Actively manage, retain, and grow current client base including preparing sales proposals for new clients, developing workflow, supervise onboarding, review workflow development, complete ongoing service assessment and supervise contract renewal.
Ensure that we are meeting and exceeding the expectations of current clients and regularly review engagements for new solutions to improve our efficiency and client experience
Monitor the progress of engagements teams against the original engagement plan and provide recommendations on changes when needed
Ensure staff are meeting client deadlines and work is GAAP compliant
Identify and resolve complex and routine accounting, audit and tax issues
Develop staff members by providing technical guidance and mentoring and provide ongoing performance, feedback and training.
Develop new business for the firm and promote the firm in the community
Develop and maintain positive working relationships with client personnel, co-workers, and all levels of staff and management.
Provide technical and project management leadership to team members and add input towards performance evaluations for staff

If you have read above and are confident you would be a great fit for this role and with our team, please apply with your cover letter and resume

items.content:
Remote Cloud Accountant needed | At InSite, we make a difference, and have a life while we do it.
Once you meet our team, you'll see why they love working here and you will too. This is a remote position and we offer all the tools to do that efficiently while staying connected to our team. Work PT or FT - we're flexible and looking for someone who loves accounting and the opportunities that come with working in a cloud firm.
Responsibilities for Remote Cloud Accountant:

Perform month-end close and year-end close
Make month-end adjustments; tie out the balance sheet and income statement
Prepare client financial statements; compilations
Solid understanding how payroll & payroll taxes are calculated
Be the go-to person for other team members; answer questions, review work as requested

Qualifications for Remote Cloud Accountant:

3 to 5 years experience working in an accounting role.
Familiarity accounting desktop & cloud applications: QB, QBO, Xero, RunADP, bill.com.
You are flexible in your thinking and trainable; you are open to learning new things.
Ideally, you have some experience with onboarding & training clients in cloud applications
You have excellent communication skills - phone, email, chat, text, GoToMeeting.
Leadership skills or potential, as there's always room to grow on our team, if you'd like.
You have a home office workspace

Benefits (just to name a few):

Health insurance (FT employees)
Simple IRA
PTO
Summertime half-day Fridays
No commute - work from home!

items.content:
Accounting Assistant at eXtension Foundation

Remote | Part-time

Hours: 30 hours/week (Monday-Friday coverage), non-exempt, benefits-eligible. 100% remote.

Target pay: $20-$23/hour based on experience

The eXtension Foundation is a membership-based non-profit designed to be the engine fueling U.S. Cooperative Extension’s advancement in making a more visible and measurable impact in support of education outreach from land-grant universities/colleges located in every state and territory. eXtension provides an array of opportunities for Extension professionals that foster innovation creation, the adoption of innovations at member institutions, and increased impact of Extension programs.

The eXtension Foundation is seeking an individual to assist with accounts payable and receivable, account review and reconciliation, financial reporting, and other business functions. The Accounting Assistant will work closely with the Chief Financial Officer and the eXtension senior leadership team. This position reports to the Chief Financial Officer.

To learn more about eXtension Foundation, visit https://impact.extension.org/ .

Principal duties:

  • A/P: Review vendor invoices per contractual terms, determine account coding, submit to Bookkeeper for payment.
  • A/R: Prepare periodic billings for services performed along with supporting detail.
  • Account review and reconciliation: Based on periodic transactional reports (e.g., monthly, quarterly) generated from the accounting system, review various account postings for coding integrity and appropriateness, coordinating with CFO as necessary. Submit corrections to third-party bookkeeper.
  • Financial reporting: Review periodic financial statements and variance reports (e.g., monthly, quarterly) in coordination with CFO.
  • Travel: Review and approve expense reports submitted through the travel system.
  • Credit Card: Gather receipts and documentation in support of monthly statement transactions.
  • Business account maintenance: Maintain business account matrix, including billing details.
  • Government registrations: Assist with maintaining various Federal and state registrations.
  • Budgets and cost proposals: Assist CFO with sponsored award budget preparation and reviews.
  • Compliance: Assist CFO with Federal sub-recipient single-audit compliance reviews.
  • Effort Reporting: Assist with quarterly sponsored award effort reporting.
  • Purchasing: Occasionally purchase supplies on behalf of eXtension staff.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

  • Required: Associate’s degree in Accounting or Finance + three years accounting experience OR Bachelor‘s degree in Accounting or Finance + one-year accounting experience
  • Required: Working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), prior payables or receivables experience
  • Required: Microsoft Excel proficiency
  • Preferred: Non-profit/fund accounting experience
  • Preferred: QuickBooks experience
  • Preferred: Experience with online collaborative tools, e.g., Google Docs and Google Sheets

Desired Attributes:

  • Strong analytical, diagnostic, and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Personable and professional demeanor
  • Ability to work daytime Eastern Zone hours

Remote work requirements (taxable allowance offered toward meeting these needs):

  • PC: Capable of running Windows 10 or macOS Sierra (Windows emulation software for Mac also required)
  • Apps: Microsoft Office (2016 or newer) desktop applications. (Google G Suite and QuickBooks will be provided)
  • Connectivity: Broadband internet connection able to support 480p live video
  • 480P (or better) webcam

To apply for this position please submit the following information to Brenna Kotar, Assistant to the CEO, eXtension Foundation, ceoassistant@extension.org:

  • Cover Letter
  • Resume
  • Three professional references, including email and phone number contact
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Senior Financial Planning and Analysis Manager at Aptible

Remote | International

REMOTE (NORTH AMERICA)

BUSINESS OPERATIONS

FULL-TIME

We’re looking for a Senior FP&A Manager to help us deepen our understanding of our business as we scale.

This is a unique opportunity to be a high-impact, early member of Aptible, and to lay the foundations for our Business Operations Team. Reporting directly to our CEO, you will work cross-functionally on critical processes that drive the success of Aptible. You’ll assume operational responsibilities that, to date, have been executed by our Leadership Team, and turn them into a well-oiled machine that results in stronger growth and greater visibility into that growth.

About Aptible

Our Vision

We see a future where it’s easy to bring a great idea into the world using the internet, while respecting data security and privacy. The next generation of businesses will design security and privacy into their operating processes. If every business is going to be a software business, every business will need to be a security business.

We’re working to make information security a core competency of every startup. We envision a world in which startups have access to great information security, are empowered to focus on their businesses instead of on compliance, can scale faster and more efficiently, and are confident that they’re creating quality products.

Our Values

Commitment to the Team

We’re passionate about building a diverse team of talented people who accomplish great things together, regardless of where they are. We talk a lot about the science of high-performing teams and how to make Aptible the best environment to support that kind of team. If you love the mutual support and camaraderie of a strong team that wins together, we want to hear from you.

Commitment to Each Other

We commit to each other as individuals, one on one. We measure our commitments carefully and hold each other accountable, which means we’re able to deliver more for our colleagues and customers in the long run. We set only a few very clear, ambitious goals as a company each quarter, and talk about them constantly to reinforce focus. We make time to recognize, praise, and reward those who consistently deliver on their promises.

Commitment to The Mission

Startups are hard, and we expect challenges and missteps. We love winning, but most of all, we value getting back up and getting better at what we do. We are deeply motivated to build trust on the internet by empowering teams, and we respect grit and perseverance in furtherance of that mission.

Growth Over Perfection

We fail often and early, and learn from it. We talk about improving constantly. We praise those who give feedback early and often. We put effort into being good at giving feedback: When we give feedback, we make each other feel big, not small. This helps create an environment where we can take reasonable risks, which in turn helps us make decisions quickly and learn fast. We expect managers to delegate a lot, and acknowledge that delegation means sometimes letting someone make what you think is the wrong decision.

Teaching as Learning

We are a team of learners. We value and respect teaching as the best way to learn, and make time to share information openly. We set explicit goals around training, and devote resources to developing and improving our internal training. We praise those who share knowledge in public — by asking and answering questions in team chat, writing documentation, and writing for our customers.

Taking Responsibility Over Giving Responsibility

Identifying problems is a good start, but we love solving them more. We think and talk a lot about how we can improve, and work hard at it. We value and reward those who take initiative. We don’t like meetings where we only talk about problems.

Asking Why

We ask “why?” a lot in order to understand root causes. Asking why helps us cultivate focus and make high-quality decisions quickly. We don’t attribute mistakes to human error. We view them as a starting point for an inquiry, not the end.

Your Impact

  • Near-Term: Your initial focus will be to help the Executive Team make better budgeting and strategic decisions — evaluating runway and burn, and testing different cash flow scenarios.
  • You’ll clean up our accounting processes, turning our monthly expense reporting, budgeting, and close processes into a machine.
  • You’ll take the results of our accounting processes and create forecasts and scenario tests that will guide strategic decision making across the company.
  • You’ll update the company with budget vs. actuals for key metrics summarizing the health of the business.
  • You’ll help us to compose regular investor updates and prepare pitch decks and other ad hoc investor communication.
  • You’ll work to streamline associated processes, such as dunning, tax, vendor payments, payroll, state registrations, sales deal desk.
  • Long-Term: Once you’ve established our Accounting and Finance processes, we’ll grow the team provide you additional leverage so that you can take on the next strategic project. Examples of BizOps Initiatives:
  • You’ll conduct pricing research to determine if/how Aptible should revise its pricing model.
  • You’ll implement a new analytics system to track critical events within the user lifecycle and providing clear, succinct dashboards that the entire company can use to drive decision making.
  • You’ll evaluate and implement a potential multi-million dollar operational cost savings that could extend runway by 12 Months or more.

Your Strengths

  • Accounting and Finance Experience: You’ve successfully built out and run Accounting and Finance for a growing B2B SaaS Company for 5-10+ years. You’re ready to use your experience to help us level up quickly and, in turn, you’ll be able to move to broader, more strategic projects.
  • Knowledge of SaaS Metrics: You understand how to calculate common SaaS Metrics, such as MRR, CLV, CAC, Churn, etc.
  • Strong Understanding of Value: You excel at finding the right metric to optimize, then driving optimization.
  • Focus on Pragmatism and Velocity: You’re excited about rolling up your sleeves and getting stuff done in the unstructured environment of a hyper-growth technology startup.
  • Detail Orientedness: You know how to find discrepancies between two CSVs, and can spot where a process is brittle or prone to error. You build checks into your analyses, and have experience working in a role where you were responsible for giving attention to detail.
  • Problem Solving Skills: You have experience analyzing data to understand trends and develop recommendations for action. You have experience analyzing root causes and identifying creative solutions to complex business problems we may not have encountered before.
  • Process Design Skills: You have experience building systems, driving their successful implementation and adoption, and documenting them well.
  • Project Management Skills: You have experience running several projects at once in a dynamic environment. You’re comfortable working collaboratively with multiple stakeholders, taking initiative to move projects forward and deliver results on time.
  • Verbal and Written Communication Skills: You enjoy actively listening to and communicating with people to understand their needs and gain their trust. You have experience drafting clear communications that demonstrate discretion, good judgement, and attention to detail.
  • Bonus Experience (Not Required): You’re familiar with our operational stack, which includes Salesforce, Stripe, AWS, Expensify, and Quickbooks. You are experienced in SQL, and are comfortable with our analytics stack (Mode, dbt, PostgreSQL).

Our Benefits

  • Work from Anywhere: Enjoy the flexibility of working from home, a local co-working space, or your favorite coffee shop.
  • Open Vacation Policy: We encourage you to take the time you need, when you need it — for any holiday or matter of personal importance.
  • Paid Parental Leave: We offer job-protected Paid Time Off — 12 Weeks, Fully Paid — for all parents to bond with a newly born, adopted, or fostered child.
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance: We offer comprehensive health care for employees, with 100% of premiums paid by Aptible.
  • Hardware & Software: We help you create your ideal office setup and provide any software you’ll need.
  • Company Travel: We come together in-person at least two to three times per year, in locations around the globe.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We prioritize diversity within our team and value different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

Apply for job

We're a VC-backed digital insurer. We use machine learning, automation, our own technology stack and comprehensive data integrations to be quicker, cheaper and fairer to customers. Where big insurers have agents, we have algorithms - a difference we are banking on creating one of the most influential financial services companies of this generation.


We're a team of 35 with experience at the likes of Intercom, Monzo, Transferwise, Depop, backed by investors who have backed Spotify, Monzo, Adyen and others. Over the next 2 years we will grow the team to 150, as we expand our revenue product offering and geography - pushing further in to the multi-trillion $ insurance market.


We are hiring a fully-qualified accountant to join our finance team.


WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING...



  • COLLABORATING WITH OUR HEAD OF FINANCE TO MAKE SURE THAT OUR BOOKS ARE IN ORDER

Finance Assistant





Do you want to join an exciting start-up in the IoT health space? Do you like supporting devices, software, and apps? Do you dream about real-world experience supporting large-scale applications connecting people and devices together using a variety of technologies? Are you motivated by working in a fast-paced dynamic environment? We have an exciting opportunity for a Finance Assistant to join our rapidly growing team.





Salary £25K - £28K





Responsibilities:



  • Ensuring all transactions relating to sales and purchase ledgers are properly recorded in the finance system in accordance with due process

  • Ensuring all expense claims are processed and paid in a timely manner and managing the purchase order process following the authorisation matrix

  • Liaising with the Front of House to replenish office consumables, and managing all online purchase platforms

  • Carrying out regular bank reconciliations and control accounts/ledger accounts reconciliations

  • Reconciling customer/supplier statements and ensuring that unreconciled items are followed up

  • Preparing and producing monthly payroll using the finance system according to deadline and company procedures

  • Logging starters and leavers onto the payroll software, and ensuring all new starters have completed their onboarding process

  • Managing employee monthly pension payments and other benefits

  • Assisting in the reconciliation and preparation of quarterly VAT returns and any other regulatory returns

  • Dealing with pension contributions and paying the pension provider in a timely manner

  • Accurately inputting information on starters and leavers and reconciling with the finance system

  • Providing assistance with HR administration; supporting the recruitment and induction processes

  • Carrying out ad hoc duties as required





Skills and Experience:



  • Experience as an Accounts Assistant or a similar role

  • Previous payroll and HR administration experience essential

  • Understanding the sensitivity of the role and the need for respect towards it

  • AAT qualified or studying towards achieving an accounting qualification

  • Attention to detail

  • Excellent organisational skills

  • Excellent telephone manner

  • Excellent time management

  • Good IT skills

  • Ability to work autonomously

  • A team player





Culture and Personality:



  • Willing to work hard but also have fun

  • Good sense of humour

  • Entrepreneurial spirit

  • Innovative and open-minded

  • Tenacious problem-solver

  • Proactive self-starter

  • Able to work as part of a wider team

  • An appetite for learning

  • A passion for technology of all types



  • An interest in health and wellbeing

  • Enjoys a social office atmosphere

  • An appetite to achieve great things and to help many vulnerable people remain independent in their own homes





Benefits:



  • 30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays

  • Fruits, Coffee, Tea and breakfast all are in office

  • Remote working possible

  • Private Health Insurance

  • Life Insurance

  • Pension scheme

  • Office dog (hypoallergenic)

  • Relaxed start-up environment - your input matters

  • Company laptop





About MySense


MySense is a wellbeing analytics platform built on compassion, by people who understand what it’s like to care for a loved one. But we’re also a team of dedicated (self-proclaimed) nerds, tech is what we know and love. So, we have combined these two drives and created a product we can be proud of.


The idea is that peace of mind about a loved one’s wellbeing should be at people’s fingertips no matter who or where they are. To do this, we created a wearable device and 11 sensors that can be placed around someone’s home. Each sensor picks up information about a key activity. This means looking at drinking and eating habits, toilet usage, sleep patterns and heart rate (approximately 5,000 data points). These sensors collect data that our AI then analyses for any patterns of decline in wellbeing. When we start to notice that something isn’t looking ideal, we send caregivers notifications so they can address problems before they escalate.


 


Check us out:


https://www.mysense.ai


https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense


 


We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

items.title: Financial Software Product Manager
items.content:
Financial Software Product Manager at Deltek Inc.

Remote

US HDQ-Herndon, VA, US HDQ-Remote, US Midwest-Remote, US Portland, OR, US Remote, US Woburn, MA, US Woburn-Remote

5284BR

Position Responsibilities

We are seeking a bright, collaborative and driven individual to join our growing global Product Management Team, with a particular focus on architecture, engineering and consulting focused ERP product: Vantagepoint/Vision.

Do you have a passion for accounting and financials and a thirst for software product innovation? You will join a team who combined have many years of experience with both the Vantagepoint/ Vision product and the architecture, engineering and consulting industries. This team is looking to invest in someone who wants to embark on a journey into strategic product management. You’ll get involved in understanding client requirements, work closely with engineering team to translate those requirements into product features and be at the forefront of innovation and learn from the very best in the market, as we aggressively drive our product and technology roadmaps forward to continue to provide a world-class solution for organizations within the agency and market.

You must have proven financial accounting ERP experience, using Vantagepoint/Vision or a similar ERP system and have a huge thirst for personal and professional growth. Not for the faint-hearted, this will be a fast-paced and at times, intense role, involving working with internal product experts globally with multiple demands, where you’ll be expected to use your financial accounting experience to bring value to this challenge. Above all, you must love what you do! Below are some of the key responsibilities of this role through the lifecycle of managing requirements from inception to product release:

  • Create and own product requirements; establishing a business case for overall need and prioritization
  • Perform detailed requirement specifications for new enhancements; particularly related to the accounting, finance, tax, global compliance and multi-company/multi-currency functionality
  • Conduct competitive analysis in order to understand the key trends in the industries served by the Vantagepoint/Vision product
  • Work with key stakeholders across the organisation to define and prioritize requirements for new features and enhancements
  • Assist in defining and managing incremental release plans related to product area ownership, to achieve overall roadmap vision
  • Work with our Engineering teams to transform requirements into compelling product enhancements
  • Working with our Product Marketing teams to enable the Sales and Service teams to maximize the impact of product enhancements
  • Actively participate in product launch to gauge user adoption
  • Assist our customer care organization with product questions pertaining to the accounting and finance areas of the product
  • Support our sales and account management teams with prospect development and pursuits
  • Deliver presentations and training to internal groups and external customers as a part of release readiness, user groups and corporate conferences

Qualifications

To be successful in this role, we expect you will have at least 5 years’ experience with accounting systems working at an ERP/financial systems software vendor or as a practitioner working in an organization using a relevant ERP solution and the ability to demonstrate the following:

  • Knowledge of architecture, engineering and consulting organizations; market trends, operations and business drivers
  • In-depth knowledge of core back-office processes, global statutory and tax requirements and related financial reporting requirements
  • Experience working in a finance role
  • Experience operating under minimal supervision, with wide latitude for independent judgment
  • Commercially minded and proven success of building strong working relationships with cross functional teams
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate clearly with both business and technical stakeholders’ one on one, and in groups of varying size
  • Ability to formulate and present a convincing business case and product roadmap to executive management
  • Experience managing the complete product development lifecycle would be a plus
  • Experience leading user focus groups to elicit requirements and formulate use cases

We’d really like a self-starter that can produce results with minimal direction but yet a team player who is able to quickly develop internal relationships.

If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!

Company Summary

Better software means better projects. Deltek is the leading global provider of enterprise software and information solutions for professional services, management and IT consulting, architecture and engineering, marketing and advertising agencies, government contractors and other project-based businesses. More than 23,000 organizations and millions of users in over 80 countries around the world rely on Deltek for superior levels of project intelligence, management and collaboration to research and identify opportunities, win new business, recruit and develop talent, optimize resources and streamline operations. Our industry-focused expertise powers project success by helping firms achieve performance that maximizes productivity and revenue.

items.title: Modern Tribe: Bookkeeping Assistant
items.content:
Bookkeeping Assistant


The Opportunity

The Bookkeeping Assistant role at Modern Tribe is a champion for the Ops and Finance teams. This role helps to drive Ops/Finance projects forward, both the cyclical monthly efforts as well as entirely new projects. If you thrive on being helpful and supporting a growing team by resolving and investigating team member inquiries, assisting in coordinating company-wide activities, and preparing AR/AP this gig might be for you.

Responsibilities

  • Assist in the day-to-day activities of the ops team to assure efficient and effective organizational activities
  • Provide support to Modern Tribe’s Bookkeeper
  • Support ops/finance in resolving or investigating team member inquiries
  • Identify areas of inefficiency within the Ops and finance team and collaborate to improve


Personal Competencies

  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Fluent English speaker

Knowledge & Experience

  • 1-3 years of experience within an Agency environment or in-house ops team
  • Knowledge of remote office procedures and workflows
  • Experience exercising discretion and confidentiality with sensitive company information
  • Excellent organizational skills with an ability to think proactively and prioritize work
  • Experience working on a small team and wearing a variety of hats to solve problems as needed
  • 2-3 years experience accounting or bookkeeping experience in a high growth environment
  •  Proven experience with Quickbooks Online is required
  • Proficient with Slack, Dropbox, Google Drive, Google Docs etc, Google Hangouts etc

Bonus Points

  •   Experience with expense management tools such as Expensify 

Location

Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. If your timezone is outside of US business hours but you work at least 4+ hours of overlap each day, with some of that time overlapping with PST, let's chat. You must be fluent in English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily video chats with the Tribe.


Compensation

Pay range is between $20-$30 US per hour commensurate with qualifications and experience. This is a freelance contract role about 15-20 hours a week.


Inclusion Statment

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.


Perks

We believe that distributed working is a way of life. We understand what it means to work remotely. We offer consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us.

(Also, if you work enough with us, we’ll bring you on the team trips.)


Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).


Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY: Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL: Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS: It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE: Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.
  • A FREELANCER

AlliedCrowds has a unique mission: to combine technology, data, and finance in order to disrupt development. We do this by creating innovative products and new financing models that unlock capital for entrepreneurs in emerging markets, enabling them to grow their businesses, hire new employees, and contribute to the global economy. Since its founding, AlliedCrowds has consulted for some of the world’s largest development finance institutions, multilateral aid agencies, and private companies involved in development, including UNDP, GIZ, IFC, IsDB, and others.




The Role




We are looking to add an intern to help with research, analysis, business development, and consulting. This is an opportunity that gives you considerable responsibility and ownership. The majority of your time will be spent conducting research on emerging market alternative finance, conducting business development, analyzing internal data, and working on client projects.




Responsibility






  • Research and analysis for client projects; examples include:




    • IsDB Innovate - User experience and competitive analysis research




    • GIZ Entrepreneur Guide - Conduct research on alternative finance in specific countries and assist with data collection




    • WGEO Capital Finder - Business plan drafting and feasibility study






  • Editing and writing articles and reports




  • Marketing and business development support






Minimum Qualifications






  • Currently pursuing/recently finished a BA/BS, MA/MSc, or MBA in economics, development, finance, or related field




  • Proven interest in economic development and/or alternative finance




  • Academic or professional experience in research and analysis






Preferred Qualifications






  • Previous experience working in emerging markets




  • Knowledge of Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator




  • In-depth knowledge of alternative finance




  • Experience working in international development organizations (UN, World Bank, etc.)




  • Experience with data science and statistical software packages




Start Date: Immediate


Location: Roles available in Kensington & City of London + Remote working options available.


Compensation is flexible and competitive for the right candidate with equity options available.


To apply, please send your CV/resume with a cover letter and a link to your github or example of work.
